Package com.example.quickscanner.controller

Class FirebaseQrCodeController

java.lang.Object
com.example.quickscanner.controller.FirebaseQrCodeController
public class FirebaseQrCodeController extends Object
Controller for managing QR codes in Firebase Firestore.

  • Constructor Details

    • FirebaseQrCodeController

      public FirebaseQrCodeController()
      Constructor for FirebaseQrCodeController. Initializes Firestore and the users collection reference.

  • Method Details

    • addQrCode

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<com.google.firebase.firestore.DocumentReference> addQrCode(String userId)
      Adds a new QR code to the Firestore for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A Task that represents the operation of adding the QR code.

    • deleteQrCode

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteQrCode(String userId, String qrCodeId)
      Deletes a specific QR code from the Firestore for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      qrCodeId - The ID of the QR code to delete.
      Returns:
      A Task that represents the operation of deleting the QR code.

    • getUserQrCodes

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<List<String>> getUserQrCodes(String userId)
      Retrieves all QR codes for a specific user from the Firestore, ordered by timestamp in descending order.
      Parameters:
      userId - The ID of the user.
      Returns:
      A Task that represents the operation of retrieving the QR codes. The result of the Task is a list of QR code IDs.

    • getCheckInEventFromQr

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Event> getCheckInEventFromQr(String qrCode)
      Retrieves an event from the Firestore that has QR code id input in the checkInQrCode field. throws exception if not found
      Parameters:
      qrCode - The QR code string.
      Returns:
      A Task that represents the operation of retrieving the event. The result of the Task is an Event object.

    • getPromoEventFromQr

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Event> getPromoEventFromQr(String qrCode)
      Retrieves an event from the Firestore that has the provided QR code string in the "promoQrCode" field.
      Parameters:
      qrCode - The QR code string.
      Returns:
      A Task that represents the operation of retrieving the event. The result of the Task is an Event object.

    • isQrUnused

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Boolean> isQrUnused(String qrCode)
      Checks if a given QR code is unused in the Firestore database. The method first checks if its used in check ins, and if it isnt checks if its used in promo.
      Parameters:
      qrCode - The QR code string to check.
      Returns:
      A Task that represents the operation of checking the QR code. The result of the Task is a boolean value indicating whether the QR code is unused. If the QR code is not being used by any event, the method returns true. If the QR code is being used, the method returns false.
